intro: Elatostema afrikanum, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit, with hairy stems and leaves that often have a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Elatostema afrikanum is also noted for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be irritating to the skin.
